channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump grants clemency to executive convicted in fraud scheme – report
item.description: David Gentile had just begun to serve a seven-year sentence for role in $1.6bn scheme that defrauded thousands Donald Trump granted clemency to privat...

item.title: Thousands rally in Madrid to demand snap election over corruption allegations
item.description: Pressure grows on Pedro Sánchez amid series of claims involving his family, party and administration Tens of thousands of people have attended an anti...

item.title: Ukrainian and US officials meet in Florida to discuss proposals to end Russia’s war
item.description: Marco Rubio, Steve Witkoff and Jared Kushner meet Kyiv delegation, after another weekend of deadly Russian attacks in Ukraine Ukrainian negotiators ar...

item.title: Dignitas founder ends his own life through assisted death
item.description: Ludwig Minelli, whose work had a lasting influence on Swiss law, founded the group in 1998 The head of the Swiss right-to-die organisation Dignitas ch...

item.title: Sultana attacks the monarchy, Israel and ‘pathetic’ Labour in Your Party speech – UK politics live
item.description: MP speaks to delegates in Liverpool after boycotting conference yesterday Kemi Badenoch has reiterated her calls for the chancellor to resign on the B...

item.title: Corbyn and Sultana will not lead new left-wing party
item.description: Your Party delegates vote to be led by a panel of members - avoiding a potentially explosive leadership race.

item.title: Billy Bonds: One of the finest players never to win a full England cap
item.description: Billy Bonds, who has died at the age of 79, was one of the greatest players ever to represent West Ham United and one of the finest never to win a ful...

item.title: Reeves denies she misled public over UK's finances prior to Budget
item.description: Conservative leader Kemi Badenoch says she's not satisfied with the chancellor's denial of lying and called on her to resign.

item.title: Tories urge financial regulator to investigate Reeves and Treasury over Budget build-up
item.description: Shadow chancellor Mel Stride calls for the financial regulator to investigate "possible market abuse" over briefings in the run-up to the Budget.

item.title: Husband and wife accused of using spycam and earpieces to win almost £600k at Australian casino
item.description: The husband and wife are alleged to have used a range of devices - including earpieces - to cheat card games over a number of weeks.
